verses.verse: Guard<WH8104> your steps<WH7272> when you go<WH3212> to God<WH430>'s house;<WH1004> for to draw near<WH7138> to listen<WH8085> is better than to give<WH5414> the sacrifice<WH2077> of fools,<WH3684> for they don't<WH3045> know that they do<WH6213> evil.<WH7451>

Don't<WH926> be rash with your mouth,<WH6310> and don't<WH3820> let your heart be hasty<WH4116> to utter<WH3318> anything<WH1697> before<WH6440> God;<WH430> for God<WH430> is in heaven,<WH8064> and you on earth.<WH776> Therefore let your words<WH1697> be few.<WH4592>
For as a dream<WH2472> comes<WH935> with a multitude<WH7230> of cares,<WH6045> so a fool<WH3684>'s speech<WH6963> with a multitude<WH7230> of words.<WH1697>
When you vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to God,<WH430> don't<WH309> defer to pay<WH7999> it;<WH2656> for he has no pleasure in fools.<WH3684> Pay<WH7999> that which you vow.<WH5087>
It is better<WH2896> that you should not vow,<WH5087> than that you should vow<WH5087> and not pay.<WH7999>

Don't<WH5414> allow your mouth<WH6310> to lead you<WH1320> into sin.<WH2398> Don't<WH559> protest before<WH6440> the messenger<WH4397> that this was a mistake.<WH7684> Why should God<WH430> be angry<WH7107> at your voice,<WH6963> and destroy<WH2254> the work<WH4639> of your hands?<WH3027>
For in the multitude<WH7230> of dreams<WH2472> there are vanities,<WH1892> as well as in many<WH7235> words:<WH1697> but you must fear<WH3372> God.<WH430>

If you see<WH7200> the oppression<WH6233> of the poor,<WH7326> and the violent<WH1499> taking away of justice<WH6664> and righteousness<WH4941> in a district,<WH4082> don't<WH8539> marvel at the matter:<WH2656> for one official<WH1364> is eyed<WH8104> by a higher<WH1364> one;<WH1364> and there are officials over them.<WH5921>
Moreover the profit<WH3504> of the earth<WH776> is for all.<WH4428> The king profits<WH5647> from the field.<WH7704>
He who loves<WH157> silver<WH3701> shall not be satisfied<WH7646> with silver;<WH3701> nor he who loves<WH157> abundance,<WH1995> with increase:<WH8393> this also is vanity.<WH1892>

When goods<WH2896> increase,<WH7235> those who eat<WH398> them are increased;<WH7231> and what advantage<WH3788> is there to its owner,<WH1167> except<WH518> to feast<WH7207> on them with his eyes?<WH5869>

The sleep<WH8142> of a laboring man<WH5647> is sweet,<WH4966> whether he eats<WH398> little<WH4592> or much;<WH7235> but the abundance<WH7647> of the rich<WH6223> will not allow<WH3240> him to sleep.<WH3462>
There is<WH3426> a grievous<WH2470> evil<WH7451> which I have seen<WH7200> under the sun:<WH8121> wealth<WH6239> kept<WH8104> by its owner<WH1167> to his harm.<WH7451>
Those riches<WH6239> perish<WH6> by<WH6045> misfortune,<WH7451> and if he has fathered<WH3205> a son,<WH1121> there is nothing<WH3972> in his hand.<WH3027>

As he came forth<WH3318> from his mother<WH517>'s womb,<WH990> naked<WH6174> shall he go<WH3212> again<WH7725> as he came,<WH935> and shall take<WH5375> nothing<WH3972> for his labor,<WH5999> which he may carry away<WH3212> in his hand.<WH3027>

This<WH2090> also is a grievous<WH2470> evil,<WH7451> that in all points<WH5980> as he came,<WH935> so shall he go.<WH3212> And what profit<WH3504> does he have who labors<WH5998> for the wind?<WH7307>
All his days<WH3117> he also eats<WH398> in darkness,<WH2822> he is<WH7235> frustrated,<WH3707> and has sickness<WH2483> and wrath.<WH7110>

Behold,<WH7200> that which I have seen to be good<WH2896> and proper<WH3303> is for one to eat<WH398> and to drink,<WH8354> and to enjoy<WH7200> good<WH2896> in all his labor,<WH5999> in which he labors<WH5998> under the sun,<WH8121> all<WH4557> the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416> which God<WH430> has given<WH5414> him;<WH2506> for this is his portion.

Every man<WH120> also to whom God<WH430> has given<WH5414> riches<WH6239> and wealth,<WH5233> and has given him power<WH7980> to eat<WH398> of it,<WH5375> and to take his portion,<WH2506> and to rejoice<WH8055> in his labor<WH5999> â€” this<WH2090> is the gift<WH4991> of God.<WH430>
For he shall not often<WH7235> reflect<WH2142> on the days<WH3117> of his life;<WH2416> because God<WH430> occupies<WH6031> him with the joy<WH8057> of his heart.<WH3820>
